channel.title: ZOMG! RS2 Website serverside secret Discovered!
channel.description: [size=12pt][b]Thread Network[/b][/size] [url=http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,181108.0.html]How The Script Works[/url] [url=http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,181132.0.html]Making Your Own Script[/url] [url=http://]Custom Code By .Jay Laze - Coming Soon[/url] Sorry but: Before you start reading you must know about HTML Table tags & java basics. Well while examining runescape pages today i discovered they use java scripts to have it where there worlds say things like "World 77 1122 [img]http://www.runescape.com/img/gamewin/usflag.gif[/img]US West 1 [img]http://www.runescape.com/img/title2/membership_benefits.gif[/img]Free" & stuff. They used javascripts. I just dont get wtf this means, I got a javascript book for dummies but I haven't read. Anyone know what all this does because right now all I can say is this look a whole lot like java lol: [code=javascript][/code] [hr] [size=14pt][b]Discovery's[/b][/size] Now if you want a menu like runescape serverside website is, then there is to but 1 thing.making new worlds & when it comes to that it is hard to do, but not for me! I stayed up all day working on this project & finally understand how this works & what the good thing is about this is that when you visit a server with people playing online you can actually see how many people are online! You could change things around if you wanted though XD like make a new city, but all you do is make a java script for it. I will give you link when I finish this project all the way though, not 100% sure about this working though. I just need to learn how to upload clients to websites. [b][size=14pt]World http://Stuffhere.runescape.com//l0,p0,j1 Giver[/size][/b] You will never believe it but this is actually all the worlds you see listed on the third menu website (runescape.com > Play Runescape > High Detail/Low > That page) when you go on runescape.com! [code=javascript] } e(1,0,2,"ul7",1987,0);e(2,1,2,"ul8",1995,0);e(3,0,2,"sl1",1989,9);e(4,0,2,"po4",2000,1);e(5,0,0,"po5",1917,1);e(6,1,2,"sl10",2000,9);e(7,0,0,"above2",766,2);e(8,0,0,"above3",612,2);e(9,1,2,"above4",1985,2);e(10,0,0,"me5",570,19);e(11,0,0,"jolt8",764,3);e(12,1,2,"jolt9",1983,3);e(13,0,0,"nl3",580,4);e(14,0,0,"nl4",613,4);e(15,0,0,"mn2",593,5);e(16,0,0,"mn3",915,5);e(17,0,0,"nav1",568,6);e(18,1,0,"nav2",1978,6);e(19,0,0,"nl7",612,4);e(20,0,0,"nl8",632,4);e(21,0,0,"nl11",595,4);e(22,1,0,"nl1",1346,4);e(23,1,0,"mn4",656,5);e(24,1,0,"mn5",683,5);e(25,0,0,"me6",566,19);e(26,1,0,"ul5",1044,0);e(27,1,0,"nl5",708,4);e(28,1,0,"nl6",771,4);e(29,0,0,"ul6",1900,0);e(30,0,0,"po7",1392,1);e(31,1,0,"po8",758,1);e(32,0,0,"ul1",1874,0);e(33,0,0,"at1",563,7);e(34,0,0,"at2",592,7);e(35,0,0,"at3",569,7);e(36,1,0,"at4",672,7);e(37,0,0,"nav3",562,6);e(38,0,0,"ny9",549,13);e(39,1,0,"ny10",654,13);e(40,0,0,"ny11",559,13);e(41,0,0,"ny12",558,13);e(42,1,0,"po2",741,1);e(43,0,0,"sl11",673,9);e(44,1,0,"at6",666,7);e(45,1,0,"ny13",654,13);e(46,1,0,"ny14",668,13);e(47,0,0,"above5",595,2);e(48,1,0,"above6",667,2);e(50,0,0,"ams2",985,10);e(51,0,0,"ams3",972,10);e(52,0,0,"ams4",981,10);e(53,1,0,"ams7",860,10);e(54,1,0,"ams8",847,10);e(55,0,0,"ch1",568,11);e(56,1,0,"nl10",666,4);e(57,0,0,"ch3",562,11);e(58,1,0,"ch4",666,11);e(59,1,0,"ch5",659,11);e(61,0,0,"se1",564,12);e(62,0,0,"se2",547,12);e(63,0,0,"se3",561,12);e(64,1,0,"se4",760,12);e(65,1,0,"se5",734,12);e(66,1,0,"se6",857,12);e(67,0,0,"jolt10",769,3);e(68,0,0,"jolt11",774,3);e(69,1,0,"jolt12",904,3);e(70,1,0,"po6",741,1);e(71,1,0,"mn7",670,5);e(72,0,0,"nav9",580,6);e(74,0,0,"sl3",668,9);e(75,0,0,"sl4",680,9);e(76,1,0,"sl5",719,9);e(77,1,0,"sl6",695,9);e(78,1,0,"sl7",814,9);e(79,1,0,"sl8",695,9);e(80,0,0,"jolt1",759,3);e(81,0,0,"jolt2",793,3);e(82,1,0,"jolt3",887,3);e(83,1,0,"jolt4",893,3);e(84,1,0,"jolt5",891,3);e(85,0,0,"ny1",547,13);e(86,0,0,"ny2",588,13);e(87,0,0,"ny4",542,13);e(88,1,0,"ny5",664,13);e(89,1,0,"ny6",676,13);e(90,0,0,"ny7",567,13);e(91,1,0,"ny8",655,13);e(92,1,0,"nl9",659,4);e(93,0,0,"mi1",543,14);e(94,0,0,"mi2",593,14);e(95,0,0,"mi3",561,14);e(96,0,0,"mi4",547,14);e(97,1,0,"mi5",660,14);e(98,1,0,"mi6",657,14);e(99,1,0,"mi7",664,14);e(100,1,0,"ul3",1092,0);e(101,0,0,"at7",566,7);e(102,0,0,"at8",570,7);e(103,1,0,"at9",644,7);e(104,1,0,"at10",668,7);e(105,0,0,"mn8",556,5);e(106,0,0,"mn9",553,5);e(107,0,0,"au1",1868,15);e(108,0,0,"au2",1894,15);e(109,0,0,"au3",1856,15);e(110,1,0,"au4",1296,15);e(111,1,0,"au5",1272,15);e(112,1,0,"au6",1289,15);e(113,0,0,"nav4",595,6);e(114,1,0,"nav5",648,6);e(115,1,0,"nav6",655,6);e(116,1,0,"nav7",661,6);e(117,0,0,"swe1",583,16);e(118,0,0,"swe2",580,16);e(119,0,0,"swe3",585,16);e(120,1,0,"swe4",704,16);e(121,1,0,"swe5",686,16);e(124,1,0,"swe8",661,16);e(125,0,0,"va1",549,17);e(126,0,0,"va2",565,17);e(127,0,0,"va3",578,17);e(128,0,0,"va4",573,17);e(129,1,0,"va5",688,17);e(130,1,0,"va6",695,17);e(131,1,0,"va7",682,17);e(132,1,0,"va8",676,17);e(133,0,0,"hel1",646,18);e(134,0,0,"hel2",626,18);e(135,0,0,"hel3",643,18);e(136,0,0,"hel4",625,18);e(137,1,0,"hel5",776,18);e(138,1,0,"hel6",759,18);e(141,0,0,"me1",581,19);e(142,0,0,"me2",608,19);e(143,1,0,"me3",700,19);e(144,1,0,"me4",1754,19); [/code] Each world is made like this: e(99, 1, 3, k9s, 5002, 2); [b] Representations[/b] @ - Command line telling the loop that it is a world. @ - What world it is, such as world 18, can find that code out is now. Dont need a desktop code for it XD. @ - change to 1 if client is for members or change to o if client isn't a member. @ - if frame is another color, you can define it in HTML coding though, IF you have a style sheet. @ - This is a add-on to the url runescape client uses. Instead of the www. being there they have k9s there for the www. line. @ - This is how many players that are online playing the game on world 99. @ - Country description, such as US West 1. This loop was custom writen, not riped from the javascript by the way [b][size=14pt]Country Descriptions[/size][/b] The @ is the Country Description, Here are the codes to there use XD: [code=javascript]d.write("US West 1":l==1?"us>US West 2":l==11?"us>US Central 1":l==2?"us>US West 3":l==12?"us>US West 4":l==10?"nl>Netherlands 1":l==5?"uk>UK 1":l==6?"ca>Canada East":l==4?"us>US West 5":l==13?"us>US East 1":l==7?"us>US East 2":l==8?"us>US Central 3":l==9?"us>US Central 2":l==3?"uk>UK 2":l==14?"us>US East 3":l==15?"au>Australia":l==16?"swe>Sweden":l==17?"ca>Canada West":l==18?"fin>Finland":l==19?"nl>Netherlands 2":"us>Unknown")+"");[/code] [b]Descrption | Code[/b] Organised By Numbers Lines US West 1 - 1 US Central - 2 Us Central 2 - 3 Canada East - 4 Netherlands - 5 UK 1 - 6 US East 1 - 7 US East 2 - 8 Us Central 3 - 9 Us West 4 - 10 US West 2 - 11 US West 3 - 12 Us West 5 - 13 UK 2 - 14 US East 3 - 15 Australia - 16 Sweden - 17 Canada West - 18 Finland - 19 [b]Desciption | Code[/b] Organised by US Lines Us Central 1 2 Us Central 2 3 Us Central 3 9 US East 1 7 US East 2 8 US East 3 15 US West 1 1 US West 2 11 US West 3 12 US West 4 10 US West 5 13 [b]Desciption | Code[/b] Organised by Canada Lines Canada East 4 Canada West 18 [b]Desciption | Code[/b] Unorganised by other lines Australia - 16 Finland - 19 Sweden - 17 [size=14pt][b]Function Operater Descriptions[/b][/size] Basically, if you know what strings & literals in java are then you shouldn't have a problem seeing what these do. At the beginning of the script there are strings writen into a loop [code=javascript]function e(w,m,s,h,p,l) {[/code] E - Used for making a world. Which in my case start the beginning of a world list creation. W - Telling the script to import "/l0,p0,j1" at the end of runescape.com (runescape.com/l0,p0,j1). M - I dont know to much about this, but I do think it uses the free world clients. S - H - This is to import a host line for the client which does not require a www. instead it would use things like y3s. instead of the www.. P L [size=14pt][b]Variable Operater Descriptions[/b][/size] also these go in first because the variable here is needed to write the command string down: [code=javascript]var d=document; var r=0; var u="/l0,p0,j1";[/code] d is used as document, instead of typing the whole thing it is turned into a string variable for short use of term just like the other variables such as r assigned to 0 and u assigned to world source code that is being uploaded by the world declared variable. d - Document for publishing commands are statements. r - Do know about this yet u - This is always used in all worlds you go to.

item.title: ZOMG! RS2 Website serverside secret Discovered!
item.dc:creator: @Jay_Laze .Jay Laze
item.description:
@Jay_Laze wrote:

[size=12pt]Thread Network[/size]
How The Script Works
Making Your Own Script
Custom Code By .Jay Laze - Coming Soon

Sorry but: Before you start reading you must know about HTML Table tags & java basics.

Well while examining runescape pages today i discovered they use java scripts to have it where there worlds say things like “World 77 1122 US West 1 Free” & stuff. They used javascripts. I just dont get wtf this means, I got a javascript book for dummies but I haven’t read. Anyone know what all this does because right now all I can say is this look a whole lot like java lol:

<script type="text/javascript" language="javascript"> var d=document; var r=0; var u="/l0,p0,j1"; function e(w,m,s,h,p,l) { if (r==0) { d.write("<tr>"); r=1; } else { d.write("<tr class=r2>"); r=0; } d.write("<td class="+(m==0?"f":"m")+">"); if (s==0) d.write("<a href=\"http://"+h+".runescape.com"+u+"\">"+"World "+w+"</a>"); else d.write("World "+w); d.write("</td>"); d.write("<td>"+(s==0?p+" Players":s==1?"OFFLINE":"FULL")+"</td>"); d.write("<td class="+(l==0?"us>US West 1":l==1?"us>US West 2":l==11?"us>US Central 1":l==2?"us>US West 3":l==12?"us>US West 4":l==10?"nl>Netherlands 1":l==5?"uk>UK 1":l==6?"ca>Canada East":l==4?"us>US West 5":l==13?"us>US East 1":l==7?"us>US East 2":l==8?"us>US Central 3":l==9?"us>US Central 2":l==3?"uk>UK 2":l==14?"us>US East 3":l==15?"au>Australia":l==16?"swe>Sweden":l==17?"ca>Canada West":l==18?"fin>Finland":l==19?"nl>Netherlands 2":"us>Unknown")+"</td>"); d.write("<td class="+(m==0?"f>Free":"m>Members")+"</td>"); d.write("</tr>"); } </script>

[hr]

[size=14pt]Discovery’s[/size]
Now if you want a menu like runescape serverside website is, then there is to but 1 thing.making new worlds & when it comes to that it is hard to do, but not for me! I stayed up all day working on this project & finally understand how this works & what the good thing is about this is that when you visit a server with people playing online you can actually see how many people are online! You could change things around if you wanted though XD like make a new city, but all you do is make a java script for it. I will give you link when I finish this project all the way though, not 100% sure about this working though. I just need to learn how to upload clients to websites.

[size=14pt]World http://Stuffhere.runescape.com//l0,p0,j1 Giver[/size]
You will never believe it but this is actually all the worlds you see listed on the third menu website (runescape.com > Play Runescape > High Detail/Low > That page) when you go on runescape.com!

} 13);e(91,1,0,"ny8",655,13);e(92,1,0,"nl9",659,4);e(93,0,0,"mi1",543,14);e(94,0,0,"mi2",593,14);e(95,0,0,"mi3",561,14);e(96,0,0,"mi4",547,14);e(97,1,0,"mi5",660,14);e(98,1,0,"mi6",657,14);e(99,1,0,"mi7",664,14);e(100,1,0,"ul3",1092,0);e(101,0,0,"at7",566,7);e(102,0,0,"at8",570,7);e(103,1,0,"at9",644,7);e(104,1,0,"at10",668,7);e(105,0,0,"mn8",556,5);e(106,0,0,"mn9",553,5);e(107,0,0,"au1",1868,15);e(108,0,0,"au2",1894,15);e(109,0,0,"au3",1856,15);e(110,1,0,"au4",1296,15);e(111,1,0,"au5",1272,15);e(112,1,0,"au6",1289,15);e(113,0,0,"nav4",595,6);e(114,1,0,"nav5",648,6);e(115,1,0,"nav6",655,6);e(116,1,0,"nav7",661,6);e(117,0,0,"swe1",583,16);e(118,0,0,"swe2",580,16);e(119,0,0,"swe3",585,16);e(120,1,0,"swe4",704,16);e(121,1,0,"swe5",686,16);e(124,1,0,"swe8",661,16);e(125,0,0,"va1",549,17);e(126,0,0,"va2",565,17);e(127,0,0,"va3",578,17);e(128,0,0,"va4",573,17);e(129,1,0,"va5",688,17);e(130,1,0,"va6",695,17);e(131,1,0,"va7",682,17);e(132,1,0,"va8",676,17);e(133,0,0,"hel1",646,18);e(134,0,0,"hel2",626,18);e(135,0,0,"hel3",643,18);e(136,0,0,"hel4",625,18);e(137,1,0,"hel5",776,18);e(138,1,0,"hel6",759,18);e(141,0,0,"me1",581,19);e(142,0,0,"me2",608,19);e(143,1,0,"me3",700,19);e(144,1,0,"me4",1754,19);

Each world is made like this:
e(99, 1, 3, k9s, 5002, 2);

Representations

@ - Command line telling the loop that it is a world.
@ - What world it is, such as world 18, can find that code out is now. Dont need a desktop code for it XD.
@ - change to 1 if client is for members or change to o if client isn’t a member.
@ - if frame is another color, you can define it in HTML coding though, IF you have a style sheet.
@ - This is a add-on to the url runescape client uses. Instead of the www. being there they have k9s there for the www. line.
@ - This is how many players that are online playing the game on world 99.
@ - Country description, such as US West 1.

This loop was custom writen, not riped from the javascript by the way

[size=14pt]Country Descriptions[/size]
The @ is the Country Description, Here are the codes to there use XD:

d.write("<td class="+(l==0?"us>US West 1":l==1?"us>US West 2":l==11?"us>US Central 1":l==2?"us>US West 3":l==12?"us>US West 4":l==10?"nl>Netherlands 1":l==5?"uk>UK 1":l==6?"ca>Canada East":l==4?"us>US West 5":l==13?"us>US East 1":l==7?"us>US East 2":l==8?"us>US Central 3":l==9?"us>US Central 2":l==3?"uk>UK 2":l==14?"us>US East 3":l==15?"au>Australia":l==16?"swe>Sweden":l==17?"ca>Canada West":l==18?"fin>Finland":l==19?"nl>Netherlands 2":"us>Unknown")+"</td>");

Descrption | Code Organised By Numbers Lines
US West 1 - 1
US Central - 2
Us Central 2 - 3
Canada East - 4
Netherlands - 5
UK 1 - 6
US East 1 - 7
US East 2 - 8
Us Central 3 - 9
Us West 4 - 10
US West 2 - 11
US West 3 - 12
Us West 5 - 13
UK 2 - 14
US East 3 - 15
Australia - 16
Sweden - 17
Canada West - 18
Finland - 19

Desciption | Code Organised by US Lines
Us Central 1 2
Us Central 2 3
Us Central 3 9
US East 1 7
US East 2 8
US East 3 15
US West 1 1
US West 2 11
US West 3 12
US West 4 10
US West 5 13

Desciption | Code Organised by Canada Lines
Canada East 4
Canada West 18

Desciption | Code Unorganised by other lines
Australia - 16
Finland - 19
Sweden - 17

[size=14pt]Function Operater Descriptions[/size]
Basically, if you know what strings & literals in java are then you shouldn’t have a problem seeing what these do.

At the beginning of the script there are strings writen into a loop

function e(w,m,s,h,p,l) {

E - Used for making a world. Which in my case start the beginning of a world list creation.
W - Telling the script to import “/l0,p0,j1” at the end of runescape.com (runescape.com/l0,p0,j1).
M - I dont know to much about this, but I do think it uses the free world clients.
S -
H - This is to import a host line for the client which does not require a www. instead it would use things like y3s. instead of the www…
P
L

[size=14pt]Variable Operater Descriptions[/size]
also these go in first because the variable here is needed to write the command string down:

var d=document; var r=0; var u="/l0,p0,j1";

d is used as document, instead of typing the whole thing it is turned into a string variable for short use of term just like the other variables such as r assigned to 0 and u assigned to world source code that is being uploaded by the world declared variable.

d - Document for publishing commands are statements.
r - Do know about this yet
u - This is always used in all worlds you go to.

Read full topic
item.source: ZOMG! RS2 Website serverside secret Discovered!
